Improved

Remove Active Support deprecations

In preparation for the 5.1 release, methods marked as deprecated in 5.0 are being removed. If youâ€™ve been seeing any of these warnings, you need to get on â€˜em now! Notably, this PR waves goodbye to â€˜alias_method_chainâ€™ , which was made obsolete by Ruby 2.0+â€™s â€˜Module#prependâ€™

Fixed

Support AC::Parameters for PG HStore

As of Rails 5, Active Record determines that a value needs to be serialized if it is a â€˜Hashâ€™ object. If passed an â€˜ActionController::Parametersâ€™ object instead (which no longer inherits from â€˜Hashâ€™ ), serialization would break. This change restores the original behavior.

Fix JSON encoding of â€œInfinityâ€ and â€œNaNâ€ values

If â€˜as_jsonâ€™ returns â€œInfinityâ€ or â€œNaNâ€ for any value, it causes â€˜JSON.generateâ€™ to ğŸ’¥ because these values are not allowed in JSON. Instead of being treated as primitives, â€˜as_jsonâ€™ is called on these values recursively, so that they are properly serialized as â€œnullâ€. Phew!

Fix incorrect output from rails routes when using singular resources

â€˜rails routesâ€™ was showing some incorrect output if you had singular resources defined. Specifically, routes for the # â€˜showâ€™ action would appear under the â€œeditâ€ helper, which is clearly wrong. Thanks to the rjigging of the order in which they appear in this PR, your routes should now be correct!

Correctly count new records when calling uniq on associations

If â€˜CollectionProxyâ€™ has more than one new record, a call to â€˜uniqâ€™ would yield the wrong result. This was because this method was aliased to â€˜distinctâ€™ , which is really a different concept. The original behavior was restored thanks to this reversion.
